page.title: 03BOTLEY VILLAGE
page.content: Botley village was mentioned in the first Domesday book.There is a church still in Botley that was there at that time. Since then the village has moved about half a mile away.In the village lived a very famous man whose name was William Cobbett.He wrote a book called "Rural Rides" in 1819,describing Hampshire. The village has a market square where farmers came to sell their strawberries.Botley has three main buildings:a market hall,a flour mill and a church.The market hall was built in 1848 and re-opened in 1897,the year of Queen Victoria's diamond jubilee.It is an impressive building,faced with stone and painted white.Outside there are columns and a clock tower.
